front.div:
The Elo rating system is a method for calculating the relative skill levels of players in two-player games such as
chess and Go. It is named after its creator Arpad Elo, a Hungarian-born American physics professor.
The Elo system was invented as an improved chess rating system, but today it is also used in many other games. It is
also used as a rating system for multiplayer competition in a number of computer games,
[1] and has been adapted to
team sports including association football, American college football and basketball, and Major League Baseball.
